html: Senators want to crackdown on robocalls. I spoke with @SenCapito, a co-sponsor of the TRACED Act. It would increase fines and require phone companies to use technology to identify spam numbers. Today, Congress is holding a hearing about the problem. #NexstarDCpic.twitter.com/Jwcg22sIfu
text:
Senators want to crackdown on robocalls. I spoke with @SenCapito, a co-sponsor of the TRACED Act. It would increase fines and require phone companies to use technology to identify spam numbers.

Today, Congress is holding a hearing about the problem. 

#NexstarDCpic.twitter.com/Jwcg22sIfu

html: I’ve said time and time again that a regional ethane storage hub would do a lot to benefit West Virginia. This logical follow-up to the study I authorized on the viability of the hub, which the @ENERGY has completed, is another affirmation that it’s an idea worth pursuing.
text: I’ve said time and time again that a regional ethane storage hub would do a lot to benefit West Virginia. This logical follow-up to the study I authorized on the viability of the hub, which the @ENERGY has completed, is another affirmation that it’s an idea worth pursuing.

html: Today in @SenateCommerce, I voiced my frustration at the lack of progress concerning rural broadband in West Virginia. We know the challenges: inaccurate maps, mountainous terrain, lack of competition. I’m working to expedite solutions. #CapitoConnect

html: “For decades we’ve been able to communicate w/ people on the moon, & we can’t figure out a way to deploy broadband in a mountainous state. text: I am proud to have been a part of this process, and I encourage my colleagues to join me in supporting this bipartisan deal.

html: Though conferees compromised on details, we did not compromise our principles. Passing this conference agreement is in our national security interest. It will provide the resources, the direction, and the support that @POTUS has said many times he needs to protect our nation.
text: Though conferees compromised on details, we did not compromise our principles. Passing this conference agreement is in our national security interest. It will provide the resources, the direction, and the support that @POTUS has said many times he needs to protect our nation.

html: This bill includes the highest level of funding ever in a Homeland appropriations bill to combat the opioid epidemic — more than $700 million.
text: This bill includes the highest level of funding ever in a Homeland appropriations bill to combat the opioid epidemic — more than $700 million.

html: Another government shutdown cannot and should not be allowed to happen. We need to provide certainty to our federal workers and to the American people who they — and we here in Congress — serve.
text: Another government shutdown cannot and should not be allowed to happen. We need to provide certainty to our federal workers and to the American people who they — and we here in Congress — serve.

html: To my friends who — like me — want more money for the wall: This agreement is better for the wall and better for @ICEgov than any other alternative. Rejecting this agreement would cost dozens of miles of new wall and jeopardize ICE’s ability to detain dangerous criminals.
text: To my friends who — like me — want more money for the wall: This agreement is better for the wall and better for @ICEgov than any other alternative. Rejecting this agreement would cost dozens of miles of new wall and jeopardize ICE’s ability to detain dangerous criminals.

html: On the border itself, I have been clear that our agreement had to include three elements: Physical barriers Technology Personnel
text:
On the border itself, I have been clear that our agreement had to include three elements:  

 Physical barriers 

Technology 

 Personnel

html: However, it’s important to understand the difference between compromising on details and compromising on principles. While this agreement may compromise on some of the specifics, it does not compromise on our commitment to secure our nation.
text: However, it’s important to understand the difference between compromising on details and compromising on principles.  While this agreement may compromise on some of the specifics, it does not compromise on our commitment to secure our nation.

html: This agreement is a compromise between Republicans and Democrats and between the House and the Senate. Because it is a compromise, none of us got everything that we wanted.
text: This agreement is a compromise between Republicans and Democrats and between the House and the Senate.  Because it is a compromise, none of us got everything that we wanted.

html: Beginning in the early 1990s, we built barriers in 4 sectors at our southern border. Since each was built, those sectors have seen massive drops in apprehensions of people crossing the border illegally. Let’s admit that physical barriers need to be a part of the solution.pic.twitter.com/obJZzvtlTX
text: Beginning in the early 1990s, we built barriers in 4 sectors at our southern border. html: The president’s proposal represents an honest effort to reopen the government and strengthen border security—a good faith offer that includes both Republican and Democrat priorities.
text: The president’s proposal represents an honest effort to reopen the government and strengthen border security—a good faith offer that includes both Republican and Democrat priorities.

html: GOP BILL: End the Shutdown and Secure the Border Act (aka @POTUS’ proposal) would immediately reopen the closed portions of the government and fund border security. DEM BILL: Would fund the government through February 8 without funding for any physical barrier at the border.pic.twitter.com/CwXel8HQrG
text:
GOP BILL: End the Shutdown and Secure the Border Act (aka @POTUS’ proposal) would immediately reopen the closed portions of the government and fund border security.

DEM BILL: Would fund the government through February 8 without funding for any physical barrier at the border.pic.twitter.com/CwXel8HQrG

html: This is one of the reasons I care so deeply about border security. Stopping drugs at the border means stopping them before they get to West Virginia communities.https://twitter.com/CBPSanDiego/status/1086021528754413568 …
text: This is one of the reasons I care so deeply about border security. Stopping drugs at the border means stopping them before they get to West Virginia communities.https://twitter.com/CBPSanDiego/status/1086021528754413568 …

html: I believe we should embrace that spirit of compromise to end this shutdown and secure our border. What can’t be compromised is our nation’s security.
text: I believe we should embrace that spirit of compromise to end this shutdown and secure our border. What can’t be compromised is our nation’s security.

html: No one — not the president — not any senator — and not any representative gets everything they want in this bill. That is the nature of compromise.
text: No one — not the president — not any senator — and not any representative gets everything they want in this bill. That is the nature of compromise.

html: .@POTUS has made a significant concession by asking that we include a provision giving three years of certainty to those covered by the DACA executive order — as well as some who have been on Temporary Protective Status. That provision is included in this amendment.
text: .@POTUS has made a significant concession by asking that we include a provision giving three years of certainty to those covered by the DACA executive order — as well as some who have been on Temporary Protective Status. That provision is included in this amendment.

html: The amendment that Dems have proposed reopens the government through February 8th. It provides no new resources to address the security and humanitarian crisis on our southern border. Passing the Schumer plan would put us in the same situation on February 8th that exists today.
text: The amendment that Dems have proposed reopens the government through February 8th. It provides no new resources to address the security and humanitarian crisis on our southern border. Passing the Schumer plan would put us in the same situation on February 8th that exists today.

html: The combination of technology and personnel — both at our ports of entry and along the border —along with the border wall system will enhance our security and choke off a major source of the heroin and fentanyl that has devastated families in West Virginia and across the country.
text: The combination of technology and personnel — both at our ports of entry and along the border —along with the border wall system will enhance our security and choke off a major source of the heroin and fentanyl that has devastated families in West Virginia and across the country.

html: We have 654 miles of physical barrier in place today. If we pass this amendment, we can build 234 more miles in areas like the Rio Grande Valley, where career Border Patrol personnel tell us it is needed most.
text: We have 654 miles of physical barrier in place today. If we pass this amendment, we can build 234 more miles in areas like the Rio Grande Valley, where career Border Patrol personnel tell us it is needed most.

html: We are here in this body to work together. To get over any rifts we may have, and to move forward to do the people’s work. We have to fix this situation, and we have to fix it now. We can do that with the president’s proposed compromise.
text: We are here in this body to work together. To get over any rifts we may have, and to move forward to do the people’s work. We have to fix this situation, and we have to fix it now. We can do that with the president’s proposed compromise.

html: A shutdown is no way to govern. It’s a disservice to our federal workers. It shows our inability to do our job with those on the other side of the aisle. It’s a signal to the American people that we think this confusing and ineffective way to run the government is OK. It’s not.
text: A shutdown is no way to govern. It’s a disservice to our federal workers. It shows our inability to do our job with those on the other side of the aisle. It’s a signal to the American people that we think this confusing and ineffective way to run the government is OK. It’s not.

html: In the past several days and weeks, there has been a lot of talk about who has leverage, who is “winning,” and what the political stakes are. Those are not the questions on the minds of federal workers.
text: In the past several days and weeks, there has been a lot of talk about who has leverage, who is “winning,” and what the political stakes are. Those are not the questions on the minds of federal workers.

html: Did you know September is National Childhood Cancer Awareness Month? I’m proud to have introduced the Childhood Cancer STAR Act to expand research opportunities, enhance quality of life for survivors. Read more about the bill, which @POTUS signed in June. http://bit.ly/2sJpBlh pic.twitter.com/sznDJWTMVm
